Cover the basics of ArrayList from the first day lecture.

November 22, 2017 Students: Look for three dots. You write the necessary code there.

Method Detail

doubleUp

public void doubleUp(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> quans)
Duplicates all Integer values that are a multiple of three in an ArrayList. If the multiple of three is at "n" position, that value is now at both position "n" and "n+1".

Postcondition:
Duplicates all Integer values that are a multiple of 3 in an ArrayList
Parameters:
quans - an ArrayList of Integers

generateEmptyArrayList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> generateEmptyArrayList()
Generates an empty ArrayList.

Returns:
an empty ArrayList

generateFixedData

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> generateFixedData()
Generates a predictable sequence of numbers with many identical values to test the two methods that "remove neighboring duplicates".

Returns:
an ArrayList of selected numbers

generateRandomData

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> generateRandomData()
Generates random numbers between -500 and 500. The number of random numbers is itself a random number between 0 and 20.

Returns:
an ArrayList of random numbers

getMaxOfData

public int getMaxOfData(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> values)
Finds the maximum Integer in an ArrayList. If the ArrayList is empty, the smallest integer value is returned.

Parameters:
values - an ArrayList of Integers
Returns:
maximum numbers in an ArrayList

getMinOfData

public int getMinOfData(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> vals)
Finds the minimum Integer in an ArrayList. If the ArrayList is empty, the largest integer value is returned.

Parameters:
vals - an ArrayList of Integers
Returns:
minimum numbers in an ArrayList

interactWithUser

public void interactWithUser()
Allows the user to select what action he or she wishes to make. The desired action is then executed.

productOfData

public long productOfData(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> numbs)
Generates a product of all the Integers in an ArrayList.

Parameters:
numbs - an ArrayList of Integers
Returns:
product of all numbers in an ArrayList. If the ArrayList is empty, return 0

removeAllButOneNeighboringDuplicates

public void removeAllButOneNeighboringDuplicates(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> quantities)
Removes all but one duplicate, contiguous Integer values from an ArrayList. If the same value is repeated in three contiguous positions, only one of the values remains. Likewise, if the same value is repeated in "n" contigous positions, only one of the values remains.

Postcondition:
If "n" identical neighboring values in the ArrayList, "n-1" of them are removed
Parameters:
quantities - an ArrayList of Integers

removeAllNeighboringDuplicates

public void removeAllNeighboringDuplicates(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> collectionOfNumbers)
Removes all of continguous Integer values that are from an ArrayList. If removing of values creates continguous identical values, they are to be removed.

Postcondition:
All of neighboring Integer values that are the same are removed from the ArrayList
Parameters:
collectionOfNumbers - an ArrayList of Integers

removeOdds

public void removeOdds(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> seriesOfNumbers)
Removes all odd Integer values from an ArrayList.

Parameters:
seriesOfNumbers - an ArrayList of Integers

replaceEvenWith6

public void replaceEvenWith6(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> numSeries)
Turns all even Integer values in an ArrayList to the value of 6.

Parameters:
numSeries - ArrayList of Integers

setAbsolute

public void setAbsolute(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> seriesOfNums)
Turns all Integer values to their absolute values in an ArrayList.

Parameters:
seriesOfNums - an ArrayList of Integers

sumOfData

public long sumOfData(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> nums)
Generates a summation of all the Integers in an ArrayList.

Parameters:
nums - an ArrayList of Integers
Returns:
sum of all numbers in an ArrayList
